meanings.sent1: After the accident, she developed alexia and struggled to read books.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with alexia after she couldn't recognize letters anymore.
meanings.sent3: When she tried to read, her alexia made the words dance around on the page.
meanings.sent4: Her alexia turned the once familiar letters into a mysterious code she couldn't decipher.
meanings.sent5: The alexia in her brain created a barrier between her and the written word.

meanings.definition: Loss of the ability to understand written or printed language
meanings.sent1: His sudden alexia left him feeling lost in a sea of words he couldn't comprehend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed the student's alexia when he couldn't follow the text in the book.
meanings.sent3: His alexia made reading a book feel like trying to solve a puzzle without all the pieces.
meanings.sent4: The alexia in his mind turned sentences into a jumble of meaningless symbols.
meanings.sent5: The profound alexia he experienced made him realize the power of written language.
